intro: Hemigraphis humilis, commonly known as the dwarf赪尾草, is a low-growing evergreen perennial native to Southeast Asia. It features dense, dark green foliage with striking, red-veined leaves that create a vibrant contrast. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Hemigraphis humilis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and ability to form thick, lush ground covers.
